revised_title: Geometrical Forms and Growth Patterns of Turbinated Shells
tldr: The author examines the geometrical forms and growth patterns of turbinated shells, specifically focusing on the role of the logarithmic spiral in their construction. They explain how the spiral shape allows for the expansion of the shell's spiral chamber and the operculum, which is essential for the survival of the animal. The author also discusses the potential applications of this growth pattern in engineering and technology.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Paleontology
